key_points: Marine Sgt. Johanny Rosario, 25, was killed in a suicide bombing at Kabul airport while screening women and children.
Rosario and Sgt. Nicole L. Gee were the two female Marines killed in the attack, among 13 US service members and up to 169 Afghans.
Lt. John "Jack" Coppola praised Rosario's service and sacrifice as epitomizing Marine values.
Lawrence Mayor Kendrys Vasquez announced the city will honor Rosario's heroism.
Rosario had 6 1/2 years of military service and received multiple military accolades.
Retired US Army Major Kathleen Romano and Rev. Paul O'Brien spoke highly of Rosario's leadership and character.
The Dominican Republic's embassy and US Senators Elizabeth Warren and Edward J. Markey paid tribute to Rosario.
Rosario briefly attended Bridgewater State University, studying criminal justice.
A vigil was held in Bostonâ€™s Seaport District by Massachusetts Fallen Heroes to honor Rosario and the other service members killed.
Community members, including an Air Force veteran, expressed deep sorrow and frustration over the loss.
spokespersons: Jaime Melendez Jr. (Director of Veterans' Services, Lawrence)
Wanda Marquez (Program Worker, Salem State University's Upward Bound Program)
Sonia Guzmán (Dominican Ambassador to the US)
Frederick W. Clark Jr. (President, Bridgewater State University)
